resources.string: In most cases, the problem is not cause by this app.
To saving copies, storage permission is necessary.\nPlease grant permission and try again.
Save the copy to Download/<app name>.

This app adds the "%1$s" action to "Open with" menus. When you open a file with "%1$s", a copy of the file will be saved to the "Download" folder.

Delete original file requires the original app to allow writing, but almost no one does. Therefore we did not provide this feature.

In order to keep your home clean, this app does not show in the home app (except Android 10). To uninstall, please go to system settings.
Save a copy for this file?
